name: Virunga Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is nothing to fault about this lodge. The banda (individual cabins) are beautiful, big, clean, private, quiet and nicely designed. The service is impeccable, everyone is polite and helpful. The views of the lakes, valley, and volcanoes is spectacular. Sipping a glass of chilled white wine on the terrace admiring the view is a a very pleasant way to spend an afternoon after gorilla trekking. The lodge is an expensive stay but it's so good it still seems value for money. The only possible downside compared to other lodges in the area is that it is a 45 minute drive from the lodge to the gorilla trekking ranger station where you start your day of trekking, meaning a 5am wake-up call and 6am departure from the lodge. I would guess that the other lodges and hotels are closer. For us the views and venue were well worth it.
reviews.title: Fantastic base for gorilla trekking

reviews.text: This place was home for four days, it was about a 2-3 hr from Kigali, a very pleasant drive and a great way to see the country with a thousand hills.    There were four in our group with three rooms, my room was no. 1., close to the main lodge and with a beautiful view of the lake beneath, other rooms had views of either the lake or the volcanoes with their stunning cloud formations.  The room was really a spacioua cottage, with a nice terrace area with lounge chairs,  a four poster bed with mosquitoes netting ( but I did not get one single bite during the 5 days in this country) tons of candles, electricity and hot water from solar panels, comfy sitting sofa and writing desk, and a cheerful bathroom and toilet that looked out at the scenery in the garden.
reviews.title: Stunning Serene hotel in the middle of Paradise

reviews.text: It was rainy season so we had momentary bursts of sunshine and warmth but also hours of cold wet weather where we congregated along with fellow travellers around the fireplace in the main lodge to swapped tales and photos.  All meals were served in the main lodge as well, good food in general and unlimited alcohol.
reviews.title: Stunning location, incredible gorillas but very expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was not luxurious the way Indian safaris are ( ie not the Oberoi Jaipur "tents" with marble bathrooms, tubs and quilted tents) but it was comfortable and mostly built from local material (ie volcanic rocks).
reviews.title: Great Hotel, stunning views, but remote location

reviews.text: Views were amazing all over the property, plenty of opportunity to admire the volcanoes, the abundant birdlife, or take one of the walks around the property.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.text: Eco Lodge? Being picked up at the airport and being driven to the lodge in a car that seemed like it was 30 years old and that was spewing out diesel fumes was far from an eco-friendly experience. Besides the eco-thing being somewhat overblown, this was an excellent stay for the gorillas.
reviews.title: Recommended for Gorilla trecking

reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious and we had an excellent view over the lake. Very comfortable beds and the mosquito net was set up every night although I am not sure it was really needed given the altitude.. The room is not particulary well lit due to the lack of electricity and there is no heating in the room which is mainly an issue when taking a shower.
reviews.title: Amazing, best spot in Rwanda!!!

reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and went out of their way to always help out. Food was good given the circumstances but the options are usually limited to 2-3 appetizers and main courses.
reviews.title: Perfect lodge for Gorilla Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gorilla experience is just amazing. The 45 minute ride to the Park is not too bad given that there is a lot of time spent waiting at the park while one is being allocated a group and after that there is usually quite a bit of a ride to the location where the actual trek starts so in the overall scheme of things it does not matter too much.
reviews.title: The Most Beautiful View in Rwanda

reviews.text: Strongly recommnded as a place to stay for anyone doing the Gorilla trekking
reviews.title: You Should Go

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Virunga Lodge is a hidden gem in a truely beautiful country.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the lodge last year and were so touched by the experience that we decided to take 14 of our closest frineds and family there for our wedding. It was the first wedding the lodge has had and the attention to detail and service we recieved far exceeded all expectations. We worked with Boniface to coordinate all the details beforehand.
reviews.title: A "Must Stay" lodge
Not that great
reviews.text: You might think that arranging a wedding from South Africa in 4 months would be tricky but we recieved such excellent service from Boniface that our trip ran like clockwork from start to finish - including all our airport transfers, hotel in Kigali and different activities for 16 people every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the lodge give without a doubt the best service we have ever recieved. They have incredible attention to detail, are friendly, knowledgeable, polite and go the extra mile. They had a big positive impact on our trip and we were very sad to say good bye.
reviews.title: Volcanoes Safaris Virunga Lodge - magnificent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were also very impressed with the food. There was not one bad meal on the trip, in fact it was often a talking point how good the food was. I am a vegatarian and I was made a different and delicious meal every night - which is very rare. You are even given a pack lunch for all your activities.
reviews.title: I can't imagine a more perfect place to stay in the world

reviews.text: This lodge was my favorite on safari. The stunning views and incredible service made it a wonderful kickoff off in Rwanda. The bungalows have all been updated with running water for showers and toilets. It is an Eco-lodge, so there are not plugs in the room to charge things, which can be done at the main lodge, and the lights are limited to evenings and early mornings. It still brings a smile to my face when I remember the "good morning" that I would hear as the staff would come to deliver tea or coffee to wake me in the morning. The food was outstanding and varied. And that staff couldn't be better. They were attentive, discreet, and friendly. Just perfect.
reviews.title: Stunning location and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely Lovely 2 night stay, should have stayed 3
reviews.title: Unique experience, Solar Energy, Heavenly views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service, warm and friendly. Staff clean your boots daily when you return from hikes.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice atmosphere at meals with other guests. Great lunch packs for your Gorilla treks which was priceless and highly reccomended and unforgetable.
reviews.title: pricy but lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: DONT waste money on the golden monkeys though, as only a glimpse at a time, not worth the effort, would rather have done 2 days of Gorillas or just chill out at Virunga.
reviews.title: Amazing views and great staff!

description: In a spectacular location overlooking the Virunga volcanoes and shimmering lakes Ruhondo and Bulera.The magnificent Virunga Safari Lodge, set on a stunning hillside, has eight bandas with a panoramic view of the Virunga volcanoes and the lakes Ruhondo and Bulera. The terraced gardens on this high ridge are now well established, with a magical sunken paradise garden as their focal point. Aside from gorilla tracking , clients can climb a volcano, track the golden monkey, visit Dian Fossey's grave or go for gentle strolls around the picturesque villages near the lakes. Three hours' drive from Kigali or a long day's drive from Kampala.
